March 15, 1967
ROCHESTER OFFICE:
436 First National Bank Building
507-288-2384
Rev. Colman J. Barry, O.S.B.
President
Saint John’s University
Collegeville, Minnesota
Dear Father Barry:
Thank you for your letter of March 8 concerning the
request of St. John’s along with nine other Minnesota private
colleges of the Federal Communications Commission to reserve
FM channels for the establishment of a Minnesota educational
radio network. As I understand, this is contingent upon the
enactment of the Public Television Act of 1967.
I am most happy to learn of your extensive efforts in
the field of educational radio, and I am well aware of not only
the contributions of this avenue, but also its tremendous poten¬
tial. Therefore, in an effort to make your excellent views known
to the Federal Communications Commission and also to the Chairmen
of the respective Commerce Committees of the Congress, I am send-^
ing a copy of your letter to all three.
As soon as I receive a reply, I will write you further.
In the meantime I am enclosing a copy of a notification which
just came in today from the FCC regarding educational FM channels.
Sincerely yours^
/ ALBERT Ti, l^Ui
L-^Member of Congress
